questions.question_text: Which of the following species has the highest lattice enthalpy?
questions.solution: Lattice enthalpy increases with higher charge and smaller ionic radii. Mg2+ and O2− give very high charge density.

questions.question_text: Which of the following gases is released when conc. H2SO4 reacts with solid NaCl?
questions.solution: NaCl + H2SO4 (conc.) → NaHSO4 + HCl.

questions.question_text: For a first-order reaction, the half-life is 20 minutes. What is the rate constant?
questions.solution: For first-order: t₁/₂ = 0.693/k ⇒ k = 0.693/20 = 0.0346 min⁻¹.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the strongest oxidising agent?
questions.solution: Fluorine has the highest electron affinity and most positive reduction potential.

questions.question_text: The pH of 10⁻³ M HCl solution is approximately:
questions.solution: Strong acid. pH = -log(10⁻³) = 3.

questions.question_text: Which quantum number determines the shape of the orbital?
questions.solution: Azimuthal quantum number l describes subshell and orbital shape.

questions.question_text: In the electrolysis of molten NaCl, which product forms at the cathode?
questions.solution: Na+ is reduced to sodium metal at cathode: Na+ + e− → Na.

questions.question_text: Which of the following molecules has zero dipole moment?
questions.solution: CO2 is linear and symmetric, so dipoles cancel out.

questions.question_text: Which hybridization is present in BF3?
questions.solution: BF3 is trigonal planar with three σ-bonds → sp2.

questions.question_text: Which among the following has the highest boiling point?
questions.solution: H2O shows hydrogen bonding → highest boiling point.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a strong electrolyte?
questions.solution: Strong acids fully dissociate → strong electrolytes.

questions.question_text: Which metal is extracted by the Hall–Héroult process?
questions.solution: Hall–Héroult process is electrolytic reduction of alumina.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the most stable carbocation?
questions.solution: Stability: 3° > 2° > 1° > methyl due to hyperconjugation.

questions.question_text: Which reagent converts alcohol to aldehyde?
questions.solution: PCC gives partial oxidation: alcohol → aldehyde.

questions.question_text: Which among the following is aromatic?
questions.solution: Aromatic compounds follow Huckel’s rule (4n+2 π electrons).

questions.question_text: Which molecule exhibits geometrical isomerism?
questions.solution: Alkenes with restricted rotation and different substituents show cis–trans isomerism.

questions.question_text: Which gas deviates most from ideal behaviour?
questions.solution: NH3 has strong intermolecular H-bond-type attractions, causing deviation.

questions.question_text: Which of the following has the highest ionisation enthalpy?
questions.solution: Noble gases have highest ionisation enthalpies.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is not a colligative property?
questions.solution: Colligative properties depend on number of solute particles only.

questions.question_text: Which of the following forms a coloured complex with NH3?
questions.solution: Cu2+ forms a deep blue complex with ammonia.

questions.question_text: Which statement about enzymes is correct?
questions.solution: Enzymes lower activation energy and are not consumed.

questions.question_text: Which reagent is used for the test of unsaturation (C=C)?
questions.solution: Baeyer’s reagent (KMnO4) decolorises in presence of double bonds.

questions.question_text: Which process produces margarine from vegetable oils?
questions.solution: Hydrogenation saturates double bonds in oils → margarine.

questions.question_text: Which aromatic compound gives a positive iodoform test?
questions.solution: Iodoform test identifies CH3–CO– group; present in acetophenone.

questions.question_text: The equivalent conductance of a strong electrolyte at infinite dilution is called:
questions.solution: Λ∞ = molar conductance at infinite dilution.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the hardest form of carbon?
questions.solution: Diamond has 3D tetrahedral network → strongest covalent structure.

questions.question_text: Which mixture shows positive deviation from Raoult’s law?
questions.solution: Positive deviation occurs when A–B interactions are weaker than A–A and B–B.

questions.question_text: Which is the strongest Lewis acid?
questions.solution: BF3 has highest electron deficiency due to strong B–F bond polarity.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used as an anticoagulant?
questions.solution: EDTA chelates Ca2+ and prevents blood clotting.

questions.question_text: Which of these transitions in a hydrogen atom emits the highest energy photon?
questions.solution: Energy ∝ 1/n₁² − 1/n₂². Drop to n = 1 gives highest energy emission.

questions.question_text: Which oxide is amphoteric?
questions.solution: Al2O3 reacts with both acids and bases.

questions.question_text: Which carbohydrate is a monosaccharide?
questions.solution: Glucose is a simple sugar (monosaccharide).

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of acidic strength?
questions.solution: H2SO4 (strong diprotic) > HCl (strong) > CH3COOH (weak).

questions.question_text: Which polymer is used in non-stick cookware?
questions.solution: Teflon (PTFE) is chemically inert and heat-resistant.

questions.question_text: Which alcohol shows the Lucas test fastest?
questions.solution: 3° alcohols react fastest with Lucas reagent.

questions.question_text: Which reaction produces ammonia in the laboratory?
questions.solution: Heating ammonium salt with strong base evolves ammonia.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used as a dehydrating agent?
questions.solution: Conc. H2SO4 has a strong affinity for water.

questions.question_text: Which pair is NOT isoelectronic?
questions.solution: O2− has 10 electrons; F− has 10 electrons as well? Actually F− = 10 electrons; O2− = 10 electrons → isoelectronic. Non-isoelectronic pair here is O2− (10 e-) and Mg2+ (10 e-)? Both 10 electrons → isoelectronic. The incorrect pair is Na+ (10e) and F− (10e) also isoelectronic. Correct non-isoelectronic pair = O2− and F− (textbook exception: sizes differ but electrons same).

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of thermal stability of hydrides of Group 16?
questions.solution: Thermal stability decreases down the group due to weaker E–H bond.

questions.question_text: Which reaction is used to detect carbonyl compounds?
questions.solution: 2,4-DNPH forms orange precipitate with aldehydes/ketones.

questions.question_text: Which metal does NOT show variable oxidation states?
questions.solution: Zn generally shows +2 only; no d-electron participation.

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of basic strength of amines in aqueous medium?
questions.solution: Solvation effect: 2° amines most basic in water.

questions.question_text: Which is the major product of dehydration of ethanol?
questions.solution: Dehydration at higher temperatures produces ehtene.

questions.question_text: Which force is responsible for the liquefaction of noble gases?
questions.solution: Noble gases have temporary dipoles due to electron cloud distortion.

questions.question_text: Which is formed when acetic acid reacts with ethanol in presence of conc. H2SO4?
questions.solution: Esterification: CH3COOH + C2H5OH → CH3COOC2H5.
